meanings.sent1: She acted like the haughtiest person in the room, looking down on everyone else.
meanings.sent2: The queen's haughtiest expression made it clear she considered herself above all others.
meanings.sent3: Despite being just a squirrel, he put on his haughtiest face when challenging the cat.
meanings.sent4: The haughtiest peacock strutted around the farm, demanding attention from all.
meanings.sent5: Her haughtiest tone could make even the bravest knight feel small.

meanings.definition: Behaving in a proud and disdainful manner
meanings.sent1: He gave a haughtiest laugh, looking down at those who dared to question him.
meanings.sent2: The actress's haughtiest attitude made it difficult for her to make friends on set.
meanings.sent3: The haughtiest cat in the neighborhood refused to play with the other felines.
meanings.sent4: With a haughtiest toss of her head, she walked away from the argument, feeling superior.
meanings.sent5: His haughtiest behavior at the party alienated many of the guests.

meanings.definition: Displaying an attitude of superiority or disdain
meanings.sent1: The haughtiest student in the class always acted as if he knew better than the teacher.
meanings.sent2: Her haughtiest remarks during the meeting offended her colleagues.
meanings.sent3: The haughtiest dog at the park refused to play with any other pets.
meanings.sent4: With the haughtiest expression, she dismissed his suggestion without a second thought.
meanings.sent5: The haughtiest look in his eyes made it clear he believed himself to be above everyone else.
